Botella en 99Cervezas.

Vierte en amarillo pajizo, bastante transparente, con muy abundante formación de espuma blanca de burbuja media, buena persistencia y notable adherencia.

De intensidad media en nariz, da notas de pan fresco, malta y plátano, acompañadas de un punto cítrico.

De entre los sabores básicos destaca el dulce y el salado, así como un amargo muy suave que redondea el conjunto. En el postgusto sale de nuevo el plátano, aunque de forma más bien suave y el punto a limón. Poca complejidad.

De cuerpo medio-ligero y textura algo untuosa, es de carácter más bien refrescante. Conforme los tragos se acumulan en boca el dulce gana importancia dando la sensación de formarse una capa que se mantiene hasta el final de la cerveza, lo que le resta algo de bebestibilidad.

Una cerveza agradable, aunque se echa de menos la sensación en boca de una hefeweizen no filtrada. Está buena, pero puestos a repetir antes elegiría casi cualquier otra de sus excelentes hermanas en Schneider Weisse.
bottle. clear golden color with enough head retention. bready aroma with slightly banana. not a characteristic taste. slightly sweet. thin bodied. easy to drink.

0.5 l bottle from P&M Getränke, bottled in January 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a massive, foamy, stable, white head. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity aroma of lots of banana and clove, accompanied by a touch of vanilla and honey. Sweetish, malty, rather yeasty-spicy taste of lots of banana and clove and traces of vanilla, bread and honey, followed by a short, slightly bitter, fairly yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, quite effervescent mouthfeel, average to lively carbonation. Very good for the style!
Złote, przejrzyste, z niezłą pianą. W zapachu, oprócz bananów, trochę fajnych, ziołowych zapaszków. W smaku jak na mój gust zdecydowanie przeszkadza wysokie wysycenie. Poza tym piwo nawet przyjemne.

Bottle at Naiv, Frankfurt. Pours bright golden to amber with a small white head. Aroma of wheat, sweet malt, citrus fruit and candy. Quite high sweetness, light bitterness, hint of sour. Moderate body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation. Sweet, citrus and wheat finish. Enjoyable, refreshing and good for style.
Bottle.Golden colour with medium white head.Sparkling with lively and spicey mouthfeels hint of bananas and hops,good medium body and also hint of grass and citrus,nice overall beer.

Filtered nice big foamy head. Spicy banana yeast and bubblegum aroma. Sweet banana taste, less wheaty than the Original weiss. Good but Im still reconciling the idea of a kristallweizen. Why? Otherwise its not bad.

0.5l bottle. Clear golden body with a white head. Aroma of bread, banana, cloves and medicinal hops. Taste of bread, honey, banana, peach and a bit of spicy hoppyness. Im not sure if Ive ever tasted a kristallweizen that is so close to being a hefeweizen, but this is definitely like that. Less filling and the weizen character is restrained compared to the Schneider Original, but still nice.
0.5l bottle from hieber. pours a clear pale golden with a medium dense white head. mild aroma of citrus, candy, orange flowers. flavour of lemon, a bit of banana, and grass. citrusy and refreshing.
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is sour corn with some citrus and artificial banana. Taste is also sour corn and some yeast. Medium drinkable with something spiky on the tongue. Meh.
0.5 l bottle @ Restaurant Ringelnatz in Schleswig. Typical weisse in the nose. Cloudy and golden look with small white foam. Not lasting long. A little thin and flat in the mouth. Short aftertaste.
Keg at the brewpub. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, grainy, taste is sweet, floral, fruity.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze slomkowym z dosc obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie niezbyt intensywnebanany i gozdziki. Podobnie w smaku piwo jest ogilnie dosc "slabe" jesli chodzi o intensywnosc doznan. Wysycenie na srednim poziomie, goryczka parwie nie wystepuje a piwo jest dosc wodniste i troche slodkie. Ciekawie sie pije klarowna pszenice ale nic poza tym.

Spore rozczarowanie. Wyglądało bardzo dobrze - złote, klarowne, z bardzo wysoką, trwałą pianą. Ale aromat i smak pozostawiają wiele do życzenia. Pierwszy jest bardzo mało intensywny, gdzieś w tle majaczy goździk, jeszcze dalej banan. W smaku ogromna wodnistość i nuta banana. Wysycone wysoce, ale nie tak jak hefeweizeny. Czuć jakieś ziołowe nuty. Bardzo lagerowy charakter. Bardzo puste. Niestety nie dla mnie.

Data ważności:  31.03.2017 
 Kolor:  Słomkowy. Piwo jest w 100% klarowne. Jak na pszenicę, jest to bardzo ciekawy widok ;) 
 Piana:  Wysoka, bujna, czapowata. Biała masa drobnoziarnistego puchu, którą można zjadać łyżkami jak bita śmietanę.
Piana stoi w miejscu przez bardzo długo czas i nie opada w dół nawet na milimetr.
Po paru minutach redukuje się do wypasionego okręgu. Pozostawia na ściankach bogaty lacing. 
W skali RateBeer 5/5! 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest wybitnie pszeniczny. Od razu wiemy z jakim piwem mamy tutaj do czynienia. Nie ma tutaj żadnej ściemy. Solidna nuta estrowa podparta wysoką fenolową przyprawowością.
Nie brakuje skojarzeń z gumą balonową, dojrzałym bananem i lekkim cytrusowym kwaskiem w tle. 
Goździk na pierwszym planie, jeśli chodzi o przyprawy. Mocno i stylowo. 
I o to właśnie chodzi! 
 Smak:  W smaku sporo słody pszenicznego.
Konkretnie wyczuwalne są akcenty banana, lekka guma balonowa.
W drugim szeregu odrobina przyprawowych fenoli. Pieprz dodaje pikantności na ostatniej prostej. Wspierają go sugestie goździków.
Ponownie lekkie cytrynowe detale majaczą gdzieś w oddali. 
Goryczka jest niewielka, sam finisz kwaskowaty.
Pełnia umiarkowana.
Wysokie wysycenie i spora pijalność. 
 Wysycenie:  Wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

W ramach uzupełniania stylów na RateBeer degustuje piwo w nowym, jak dla mnie dotąd nieznanym stylu - German Kristallweizen.
Klasyczne piwa pszeniczne tzw. "mit heffe" (m.in. Hefeweizeny) są nieprzejrzyste, mętne za względu na osad drożdżowy.
Wersja Kristall jest natomiast filtrowana i całkowicie klarowna.
Oba style mają natomiast ten sam estrowo-fenolowy profil.
Sporo tutaj odnośników w stronę dojrzałych bananów, gumy balonowej, lekkich cytrusów wzmocnionych o przyprawowe nuty goździka i pieprzu.
Piwo można pić litrami. Jest lekkie w odbiorze, mocno pijalne. 
Nie jest to jakiś sztos, ale w letni dzień z pewnością sprawdzi się idealnie.

From 50cc bottle. Pours golden and crisp, of course, with very abundant white foam, fine. Aroma is malt, banana, in general ripe fruit, something like marshmallow. Very nice for a weizen. Body is light. Taste is sweet, but delicate. Finish is average. In general,a great weizen.

Bottle from Vrutak. Golden body, white head. Perfumey caramelly maltiness. Watery taste, slightly citric, some notes of plums and caramels. Solid, but definitely far from my favorite Schneider Weisse.
50cl bottle from biere-import. Clear gold color. Medium white head. Light sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is hoppy, wheat, citric, clove, banana, grilled fish skin, spices. Cool.

Aroma is moderate earthy wheat malt, moderate banana esters and clove phenols. Flavor is moderate earthy wheat malt, spicy hops and light bitterness, light citrus notes with bananas and cloves and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

The flavour is fairly dry for a wheat beer, with some citrus and cloves, hints of banana, but rather bland compared to the brewerys hefeweizens. .

Pours in light yellow colour, clear liquid, huge short living white head. Aroma of hay, herbs, floral notes. Slightly sweet, slightly bitter, some sourness. Light body, watery feel, short bitter aftetaste

pretty Solid session wheat beer. Eaay drinking and better than any wheat back in North America. But it is more reminiscent of a lager, pours very clear and light. Schneider Weisse pub Munich.

500 ml bottle. Clear pale gold with a large sized head of low retention. Aroma has loads of banana, yeast, wheats and not much else. Flavor is mildly sweet, subtle wheaty aromas. Short, watery sweet aftertaste.
Appearance is more like a lager-weisse. Aroma is lemon. A bit flat in taste. Maybe some ginger or pine notes. Feels a bit lagery. Not too sweet. Ok beginners weisse.

May 16. A 0.5 l bottle that poured a clear pale golden body with a big head. Very nice Weizen aroma, where banana, coriander and cloves were most prominent. Flavor was lightly sour and lightly sweet wheat malty, banana, chalk, even yogurt with a fine lemon note (adding to that sour counterpart) that turned occasionally into some weird off-note. Pleasant anyway. Medium bodied with a slightly watery mouthfeel. A lot of carbonation. Finish was long, sweetish wheaty. Excellent for a Kristallweizen!

Bottle from a random shop in Berlin. Bottled 4 months ago. Pours clear pale yellow with substantial off-white head. Bubbles rising from bottom. Aroma of wheaty graininess and notes of banana. Also some grassy hops noticeable. Tastes of the same notes but a bit more grainy or stale malty. The water seems exceptionally pure somehow... Really soft on the palate. Carbonation very modest yet slightly crisp. Lovely brew.

Clear, golden-yellow colored, small-medium white head, not very lasting. Aroma is of some wheat, decent amount of spices, some banana and light yeast. Taste is medium sweet wheat, banana, more spices and cloves, light bitterness and light citric. Light+ bodied, average carbonation, bit watery.
(bottle, Vrutak Zagreb)
Clear golden color with foam layer. Refreshing light wheaty nose. Refreshing taste with a rather light body. Round and calm aftertaste.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A pale golden fizzy beer with a big white foamy head ; good retention. Clove, banana, light citrus, unpleasant note (cardboard?). Light sweet, light dry bitter refreshing. Light body, thin texture, good carbonation, dry fruity refreshing finish. Overall, a fair refreshing fruity spicy german weizen.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours crystal clear straw colored with a huge creamy white head. Aroma is yeasty with some sweet esters. Taste is crisp, high carbonated, some ripe banana and weak citrus at the finish.
How : tap Appearance : clear golden with a medium to large white head. Aroma : bread, banana,spice and herbs. Palate : medium body, average to high carbonation.

Amarela clara, turva. Espuma abundante de longa duração, fina, clara. Aroma de banana e cravo. Sabor de trigo, banana, cravo e um pouco de especiarias, levemente amargo e cítrico, com amargor persistente. Acidez baixa, corpo leve.

Schneider Weisse Kristall was created by Georg V. Schneider in the 1980s. This elegant and sparkling wheat beer is not only a great refreshment but can also serve as the perfect alternative to sparkling wine and prosecco when served with a shot of elderberry syrup.

Bottle (from firma bier as Schneider Weisse Tap 2 Mein Kristall). Pours clear golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is intense fruits, banana, mango, soap. Flavor is sweet and wheaty, fruits, grains, banana, soap. Finish is wheaty with some citric acidity and slight hoppiness. Overall: best kristallweizen I have tried. It doesn feel just like "neutered hefe", but has a bit of lagerish properties and dry hoppiness, which make it more unique and likeable.

Clear yellow color with white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves and light yeast. Taste of grass,wheat,cloves, light bananas and citrus. A bit watery, average carbonation.Nothing special but nice and refreshing beer.
Bottle split two ways. Pours golden clear with a huge frothy head. Notes of banana, sweet syrup, light yeast, some apples and light herbal.

Deep golden. Tall airy head. Lacing present. Smells of spicy noble yeast, wheat, a touch of metal. Light body. Somewhat thin. Grainy taste, spicy yeast. Minimal sourness. Low hoppy grassiness on ending. OK but not leading in the style.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Slightly darker than golden, clear, lots of bubbles dancing towards the top. Big, quite dense and persistent head. Sweet but still bright aroma, strong and dominant banana, maybe a hint of vanilla. Taste is dominantly sweet but with a clean profile: screaming banana, a hint of spiciness/clove, a refreshing finish with hints of lemon. Light body, a bit watery but very easy, nice sparkly and refreshing feel on the tongue. Simple, clean, refreshing, monotonous
0.5l bottle. Clear yellow color with white head. Aroma is wheat malt with light banana and cloves character. Taste is sweet wheat notes. Overall its nice beer.

Draft at the restaurant in München. Beautiful, like really, clear golden with rising bubbles replenishing a lasting, lacy white head. Aroma is slight banana, spice, and grain. Mostly dry flavor, just a tad sweet. Banana, wheat, crisp malts. Lighter body, almost impossible not to down it in two minutes. This is a forgotten style, but when you do it well, daaaaamn guuuuurl dat shizz is goood.

Bottle, pours clear straw colour with strong high white head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, yeast, bread and strong ester notes. Taste is mainly sweet-sour. A bit to watery, but strongly carbonated.
Its ok, but nothing special. Defnitly the weakest beer from the Schneider Weisse series.

Bottle; pours clear gold with a white head; aroma of banana, wheat, and spices with a hint of yeast; taste is slightly sweet with wheat, banana, some citrus hints and yeast; finish is dry with some spice hints; decent Kristall

Aroma :malts, wheat, banana, vanilla.
Taste: Sweet, banana, sour wheat, lemon and grass tones But all friendly

 Medium body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation. Easy drinker but a bit to uncomplex for a Schneider beer.

500 ml bottle bought at EG Plus Ltds booth during the 13th Hong Kong Food Festival 2015 in HKCEC, Wan Chai.
Looks: Translucent pale golden honey colour; Explosive three finger head with crumpety white foam which lasted for 4 minutes; Fair sticky lacing and very fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment malt, with strong banana, vanilla, strong honey, floral, wheaty tartness, caramel, toffee, sugar, cloves, spices, sweet bread, strong yeast, light lemon and light grass.

Taste: Close to light sweet malt, with strong metallic, light banana, caramel, moderate wheaty tartness, phenolic, spices, yeast, moderate lemon, moderate to light bitter hops and quite strong grass. 

Body: Close to medium body. Slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Solid maltyness in a very smooth background. Sair wheat and light tartness. Notable banana and caramel, yet phenolic and yeast are light. Quite spicy, and solid lemon to round. Really nice!

Hoppiness: Light lemon and light grassy in nose, and much stronger in taste. Bitterness is very notable for an abrupt, moderately astringent malty finish.

After Taste: Quite dry. Creamy and hoppy to mouth.

Comments: Without the bottled yeast, this one stands up just as strong as Schneiders regular Hefeweiss  impressive looks and head, fruity and wholesome aroma, and the creamy, spicy, hoppy palate. Its beyond my expectation. A standard for the style. Enjoy!

On tap at Munich brewpub. A clear, greenish straw with a thick, creamy, resilient white head. Aroma is malts, wheat flour. Flavor is pale malt, rather sweet. Finish is rather stale, not much bitterness. Medium body, very soft mouthfeel and average carbonation. Very easy drink.

Good beer.

The whole of it is soulless and dull and the urine off-notes are ruinous.

Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to Mrhangover. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small off white head. Aroma of yeast, light fruits, cardboard malt, banana and light washing liquid. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and bitter.

Bottle @ WWT IV, courtesy of me! Pours a clear golden beer with a medium big, white head on top. Aroma has loads of banana, yeast, wheats and not much else. Flavor is mildly sweet, subtle wheaty aromas. Short, watery sweet aftertaste. Decent.

I can never see myself choosing this one over the regular one. This is while I surprisingly like Weihenstephaner Kristall quite a bit more than the regular version. Quite a weird beer.

Bottle. Clear golden color, thick white head with good retention. Aroma of banana bubblegum. Taste is fruity banana, lemon. Decent.

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a weizen glass. 
The appearance had the normal cloudy orange to slight brown color. Theres a slight transparency trying to come in as I do see some light bubbles around the edges rising at a good pace. The head was thick and soft full of at least a good three finger white foaminess that gently died at a nice pace. 
The smell was slightly bready/yeasty. Slight clove to coriander spice that entered in with the normal "banana" light esters to enter and fulfill its commission of the kristallweizens of kristallweizens. 
The taste was mainly sweet and carried a fairly nice spice to conjure up a fulfilling Summers night.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a great sessionability about it. Hot damn, this was really good. The carbonation was there but nowhere to be seen to be overbearing. Oh, how smooth she runs over my mouth. 
Overall, where in the heck, did this come from? Holy moses, Id have this again in a heartbeat.

On tap at Schneider downtown Munich. Clear gold pour with rich white head. Lemony, grainy aroma, not too wheaty, some light spicy clove notes persist however, nice fruitiness as well. Taste is light, lemony wheat, really easy drinking, a true thirst quencher. Palate is light bodied and rather aggressively carbed.

0.5 bottle from Alko. I thought this is the typical Kristallweizen with no taste of hefeweizen left. Well, I was wrong, there is even the taste of banana and everything. It is not cloudy but the taste is still there. Some of the Hefeweizens are more watery than this. I am impressed.
Bottle. Yellow clear. Good weiss esters, banana, some clove. And lots of malted wheat yestyness. Light bodied, bit oily slick. Estery, well carbonated. Ok flavours, bit sterile though.-- bb

Clear, orange beer with a foamy white head. Wheat, yeast and citrus on the nose. Not much carbonation. Light body. Strong banana flavor with yeast, wheat and a hint of lemon. Quite nice but not exceptionally good.

500ml bottle from Charter Mall, Changchun. Clear yellow. Some lemon in the taste, slightly sharp. Thinner than the hefe and more astringent.

Bottle. The fruity smell of bananas, light sour. The medium large white foamy-creamy head has a normal duration, the body is dark yellow. The taste is light sour and fruity, some cardboard also. The body is rather light, dry and creamy with a lot of carbonation.

Kaatuu lasiin vaalean kullankeltaisena noin parin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla, kupliakin nousee reilusti, joten hiilihapot näyttäisivät olevan kunnossa. Tuoksussa on reilusti vehnismäistä banaanimaisuutta, viinikumia ja mausteisuutta sekä yrttejä. Nyt kuitenkin tuntuu myös melko voimakas sitrusmaisuus ja viljainen mallas, vaikka ei tämä lager olekaan. Tavallaan raikkaampi tuoksu kuin "normivenhässä". Maku jää kuitenkin jälkeen normaalista, banaania on reilusti, mutta muuten maku on hieman tyhjä. Mausteet tuntuvat myös hieman, sekä sitrus, mutta muuten vahvalla banaanilla mennään. Suutuntuma on raikas ja hiilihappoinen, sekä melko kevyt. Ensimmäinen kristallweizenini, raikas ja suht maistuva, mutta kyllä tähän enemmän makua kaipaisi. Vähän turha tyyli mielestäni.

Review according to BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15A). Bottle 50cl. Batch 1651110413. AROMA: light wheat aroma with strong banana present. no hop aroma and a bit bubblegum. APPEARANCE: golden straw color with somewhat average retention white head. very clear. TASTE: moderate strong banana flavour with soft, gentle sweet wheat flavour with very low hop flavours. mild citric flavour present. well rounded. PALATE: medium body with a light fizzy finish. OVERALL: a nice filtered fruity weizen.

Eine hohe weiße Schaumkrone. Kristallklarer goldener Körper mit Tönen von Stroh. 
Aus dem Flaschenhals kommt Weizenmalz und bescheidener Gerstenmalz, einiger reifener Bananen und Gewürznelken. Das Bier duftet frisch.

Das bier wurde in der Weinmonopol Langenase gekauft, zu Hause getrunken.

50cl - Tap 2. Very refreshing, sparkling Kristall with fine hefe notes and some citrus, banana, apple. Not spectacular by Schneiders own high standards,  but a go-to thirst quencher if it would be more easily available as an alternative to Maisels in local Edekas/Rewes nevertheless.
dobre pszeniczne piwo filtrowane. Piana wielka jak mont everest. Fajnie nagazowane. Finisz gożki. Chmiele krążą w nosie i na języku. Udane kristallweizen

#607
Hübsch anzusehendes Kristall mit sehr viel Schaum und CO2. Ein sektähnliches Aroma mit etwas bananiger Fruchtigkeit. Leider auch ein sektähnlicher Geschmack, der mir nicht gefällt. Der Abgang unterstreicht dies mit einer zunehmend säuerlichen Note. Kristall-Weizen sehen in der Regel halt nur gut aus, ohne es auch geschmacklich zu sein und da macht auch das Schneider leider keine Ausnahme. Jedes andere Schneider ist bedeutend besser!
	
Test vom 2.11.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,10,9,8,9,9 - 9,30
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 Clear golden color with big head. Aroma is wheat and banana, fruity. Flavor is banana, citrus, sweet. Great kristall.

Bottle. Appearance: Golden orange, good visible carbonation, thick white head. Aroma: nice and hoppy, banana bomb, lots of wheat too. Flavour: Big carbonation at first, tons of banana, lots of wheat, quite sweet but quite refreshing, long wheat & banana finish.

Nu i retrospekt så kan jag inte förstå varför jag beställde in en kristall när de hade så många andra roliga öl på sin meny. Okej ölen är väl ändå helt okej med sin krydda och tama kropp, men den är och förblir, tråkig.
very refreshing and tasty lager.  Perfect sunny afternoon drinking.  Very slightly tart, lemony, hints of bubble gum and banana.  Perfectly balanced carbonation.
Clear pale golden colour, large white head. Fruity nose. Fruity, dry palate, hints of citrus fruit and banana.
Bottle, 2 months past best before date. Pours clear golden color with average white head. Aroma is banana, plums, cinnamon. Flavor is wheat, banana, spices, hint of alcohol. Really nice weizen.
Draft. Pours clear gold with a white head. Light fruity sweetness, with lighter spicy notes, and a clean wheaty finish. Decent.

(Flasche)  Es sieht aus wie eine Apfelsaftschorle, filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist leicht würzig mit einem bisschen grüner Apfel. Der Geschmack ist süßlich, wie ein trockener Met, mit einem bisschen grünen Apfel retronasal.

6/VIII/2012 - bottle (according to the menu, didnt actually see the bottle) @ Schneider Weisses Brauhaus (München) - BB: n/a - (2012-840) 
Clear gold yellow beer, irregular white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: quite some banana, spices, bit peppery, pretty sweet, bit floral, soapy even. MF: good lively carbon, a bit too much. Taste: quite some banana, citrus, little bready, bitter grassy hops. Aftertaste: citrus, some banana, bit sweet, spices, nice citric hoppy ending. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2012 On bottle at Dicke Wirtin, Berlin.
Golden color, good foam.
Fruity aromas, medium banana intensity & some citrus.
Light/medium body and complexity.
Fruity & refreshing
Enjoyable

Bottle. Pours a clear golden bubbly body with a big cloudy head. Nose is banana, grains and hints of herbal flowery notes in the back. Taste is mild banana, grains and hints of soap and metal. Medium body, energetic carbonation. Not too good IMO, but somewhat drinkable.

Aroma has banana, wheat, citrus. Clear golden with big frothy white head that is long. Taste has same elements as aroma. Not much nuances. Light to medium body, soft texture and carbonation. Easy to drink and quite easy to forget.
Bottle- This brew has a lightly honeyed, apricot note and a crisp refreshing finish.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma is malts, banana, citrus. 
Taste is bitter, banana sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Good kristall weissen.

Bottle in hotel room Copenhagen picked up in Aarhus. Fairly clear, yellow appearance with a bubbly white head. Spritzy carbonation. Fairly soft mouth feel. Nice, easy drinking wheat malty, lemon citrusy, bubbly flavor. Refreshing.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 At Weisses brauhaus Munich. Decent stuff. Style maintains some of the Hefeweizen qualities despite being a Kristallweizen. Serving: Bottle
The head is medium, the body golden. It smells fruity and malty. The taste is citrus CO². Not my favourite from Schneider 8/7/8/8/11/7
Fine weissbier with a great taste, although there may just be room for a slight improvement.
Not a bad German Kristallweizen although it kind of lacks on the aroma. Refreshing but I miss some real Weizen-taste.

Bottle 0,5 l - purchased at jollybeers.net
Appearance: Clear light to medium yellow color with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, white head. 
Aroma: - moderate to light - yeast, fruity, banana, bubblegum, cloves,. 
Taste:  light  sweet and a bit sour  with a average duration. 
Palate: body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.

50 cl bottle as "Schneider Weisse TAP2 Mein Kristall".
Rated on 20110612.
Pours clear golden color with a huge head. Aroma of strong banana, dry hay and some fruits. Flavor of mild banana, bitter fruits and yeast. Strong carbonation, slick palate. A bit disappointing.
4324

Bottle at the Beer, Bocce and Boozer Tasting, thanks to Paul. Pours clear yellow with a fine, dissipating white foam head. Big wheat and yeast nose. Light sweet flavor with mild wheat, banana and white sugar. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Sweet, bready finish with wheat and soft fruits. Pretty basic, but a pleasant beer.

Bottle from Utobeer at Leightons Beer, Bocce and Boozer tasting. It pours pale yellow, with a thick fizzy white head. The nose is sweet fruit (particularly banana), spicy yeast, wheat and some smoke. The taste is sweet malt, pear, melon, red apple, banana, dough, straw and hay, with a dry finish. Medium body, fizzy carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Good balance and easy drinking.

Bottle @ Beer, Bocce and Boozer tasting. Pours a clear light amber color with a big, pillowy white head. The nose is strong sweet banana, clove, sugar. The taste is much of the same, banana, bright spring water. Light, refreshing. Light body, active carbonation. Very easy to drink. Simple, but effective. Good.
Its golden with a huge, creamy, white head, and both aroma and the sweet flavor has notes of fruit, wheat, light yeast and the finish is slightly spicy - its an Ok kristall.
Bottle. golden colour with a white head. Aroma is banana, lemon, malt. Flavour is sweet, orange, malt, wheat, banana, lemon. OK beer.

Bottle from Craft. This is a simple, yet easy to drink to beer. It has a nice blend of fruit, bread, hop and light malt balance.

The finish was a tad bit of banana. Nothing great, but it was solid.

Pours golden with steady bubbles and a good head. The nose has the usual banana, cream, etc that is in tap 1, but just lighter. The taste and palate is more of the same - its good but a thinner version overall of TAP 1.
(500ml bottle, labeled Tap 2 Mein Kristall)  Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, and some banana.  Flavor of wheat, banana, and dough.

In short: A surprisingly tasty blonde lager full of overripe fruits.  Meh.
How: Bottle 500ml at La 100 de Beri, Bucharest Romania (sold as TAP 2 Mein Kristall) 
The look: Clear blonde body topped by a small white head
In long: Nose of ripe pineapples, some bananas, some lemongrass and maybe some ginger.  Taste is surprisingly sharp with ripe pineapples, lemon, lime, even tart white grapes, bananas and a strange spiciness.  With my limited experience with the Kristallweizen style I had always assumed these were bland watery german wheat beer.  Well, this one sure wasnt bland, it was actually rather tasty, unfortunately.  Weird, over-ripe and a bit aggressive, not something I could drink in large quantities.  I guess I still dont understand what is a German Kristallweizen no more than I understand why bras and batteries come in the same sizes.

Süß-hefiger und gering herber Beginn. Die Hefigkeit bietet hierbei für ein Kristallweizen breite Aromen und erstaunt mit Noten von dunkler Banane. Die Vollmundigkeit des Bieres ist absolut vergleichbar mit denen von normalen unfiltrierten Weizen, nur zum Ende wirkt das Bier herber und spritziger, wobei die Hefe nach wie vor überzeugen kann. Sprutzig, süffig, erfrischend  das perfekte Kristallweizen! 11/12/12/12/12/12

500ml bottle. Looks very refreshing with a bright golden body with a large dense foamy white head. Lots of banana esters on the nose with cloves, bread and a touch of lemon citrus. Palate is slick and medium bodied with  medium sweet flavours and clean finish with those bananas coming through at the end. A rather feminine beer - give this to your wife and have the more flavoursome Hefeweizen yourself.
es muy refrescante el olor y al paladar,no es el tipo de cerveza que me gusta pero me tomaria varias cuando hace mucho calor
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text: Bottle. Clear golden colour with a big white head. Spicy yeast, banana, wheat and malt in the aroma. Flavour is spicy, banana, wheat and malt. Good kristallweizen.

(bottle) pours a clear golden-yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of fresh banana, floral hops and sweet spices, with notes of earth and barnyard. flavour is mostly the same, lots of banana and vanilla, with an abrupt wheaty finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Draught  Very clear golden beer; thick white head. Banana, clove, not very present fruit; rainwater. Clear, but dull Weizen taste, with some banana and clove again. Light, spritzy feel. Oh well. Some people like it as such. It feels really watered-down to me.

Sampled at the brauhaus in Munich, listed as "Tap 2". Clear medium gold, medium white head. Light banana, citrus, spice aroma and flavour. More fully flavored and spicy than Ive found inothers of the style. Quite nice for a style that is usually lacking.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bottle from Bierland in Hamburg. 

Clear golden with a huge white head. Pleasant aroma of yeast, banana and wheat. The was refreshing and sour. A descent Kristallweizen.
Bottle. Clear golden color, white head. Fruity aroma with restrained hops. Balanced flavor with banana and toast. Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Very nice example of this style!
Bottle.Pours clear golden with a white head.Aroma of toffee, grassy hops,banana and wheat.Flavor is sweet toffee and caramel with some wheat and fruitiness.Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. It pours a clear, golden body under a big, white head. Rather bananaish aroma, some lemony and clove-ish hints. Sort of sugary. Its a bit thin on the palate, with pale malts and cloves and a good dash of banana sweetness. Banana finish. A quite nice kristall. 110917

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of wheat, malt, caramel and banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Pours clear yellow. Aroma and taste of banana and cloves more prominent in this. Unpleasant texture

Bottled 0.5L. Wheaty, yeasty and slightly bananey nose. Large pale head of large bubbles. Fast disappearing. Clear pale golden colour. Slightly sour wheaty and yeasty taste with some lemon hints. Mild hops.

Bottle 50 cl, Alko Tampere. Pours clear golden with a huge fizzy white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is so nice; yeasty, bananas, cloves, wheat, fruity and sweet. Flavor is acidy, fruity, sweet, yeasty, wheaty and cloves. Finishes bitter fruity.

50 cl bottle. Rated on 3.6.2011
Rather light aroma has some banana esther and bubblegum with hints of wheat. Somewhat light and slightly sweet flavour has banana and wheat with some citrus. Too thin and light, but what can one expect from a kristall weisse?
Bottle from Alko. Clear pale white colour, tall white head vanishing quickly. Aroma and taste are quite bananic and moderately sweet. Quite good in its style.
Thick foam, very clear in colour. Noticeable feats of malt and wheat present in the taste. Even with the yeast filtered this beer has some typical Schneider notes. Very refreshing on a summer day.

Bottle. Light golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty - lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, some banana, faint fruitiness and spiciness. Body is light to medium, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, some banana, faint fruitiness and spiciness.  Finish is short, malty and lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, some fruitiness and banana. Quite one-dimensional and un-interesting kristallweizen.

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear pale golden colour with big white head.
Sweet fruity wheaty and sugary aroma.
Sweet fruity hops, wheat and sugary sweetness in flavour.
Something artificial in flavour but otherwise very good Kristallweizen.
Clear golden body under a big foamy white head. Citrus, clove, spice and a hint of fruit and banana. Little on the fizzy side and clean tasting Kristall.

0.5 l bottle from Alko. Golden color, sparkling appearance. Sweetish aroma with honey, clove and pepper. Peppery and clovey flavor with some banana and some herbal notes as well. Full bodied and highly carbonated. Fairly good for a kristal weizen.
Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Flavor is malts, wheat and banana. Quite full for a kristall. Nice.

500ml bottle (K Market, Kamppi)
5 Estery fruity wheeaty aroma, quite sharp.
2 Pale, enormous brief head, but I did pour it like a doofus.
5 Minerally wateriness, quite chemical, a bunch of weird estery spikes too. None of the richness or breadiness I want from a wheat beer.
2+ Thin palate, soft carbonation. Initial finish is a blast of dodgy chemicals, but is does settle down to something pleasantly hoppy and wheaty. 
8 Just not doing it for me. Not worth the annoyance of the taste and immediate finish in order to get the pleasant long finish.
500 ml bottle. Pale yellow colour, medium-sized foamy head. Aroma of wheaty malt, banana, citrus  and spices. The flavour is sweetish wheaty, with notes of banana and spices. A little thin and bland.

Bottled (from Alko). Goldeb colour with a mediumsized white head. Aroma is wheat, mild fruits as well as some mild sweet maltyness. Flavour is wheat, mild fruityness as well as some wooden and  earthy notes. Quite pleasantly balanced.

Taste is very fresh. The wheat is light and has some grainy notes. The yeast is most dominant in the beer, giving banana, lemon and some pine-apple. The mouthfeel is smooth. Aftertaste is light and crisp.
50cl bottle. Poured pale golden witha frothy white head. Sweet wheaty aroma, some candy notes. Flavor is sweet wheat and ripe bananas. Bit thin. Too sweet for my liking.
50 cl, bottled. Pours bubbling clear golden beer with a minimal head. Aroma: Wheat, fruits. Taste: Sweet. Banana flavours. Palate: Light body, high carbonation. Surprisingly dry finish.
Poured clear golden in colour with foamy white head. Sweet wheat and spices in aroma with some exotic fruity bubblegum. Mostly sweet wheat in flavour. Too sweet. Pretty tasteless actually and watery.

Golden yellow beer with a big and white head. Lots of wheat and sourness in the aroma, also some spicys and bananas. Taste is wheatish and sour, quite lot of bananas; taste is quite nice, but it is too short. Quite light to drink and slightly biting carbonation. Everything are OK in this Krisstall Weisse, but always in this style and also in this beer it feels that something is missing.

Bottled. Pale golden colour, quite weak, soapy head. Sweet, somewhat grainy wheat aroma with medium intensity banana aroma. Bubblegummy yeasty notes with a dash of cloves. Shallow flavor, grainy sweetness and slightly sour finish with light hoppiness. Medium bodied, quite thin finish.  Soft texture, slightly tacky finish.

Bottled 500ml (Alko, BB 03/2011)
Clear golden color, big cloudy white head. Bubblegummy wheaty and malty nose. Light to medium bodied. Crisp carbonation. Quite sweet banana-bubblegum flavor with some dry berry stone notes. Short finish. Refreshing summer drink. As good as kristallweizen can be.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a light yellow colour with a large, white, foamy head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and bready malts. Flavour of caramel malts, citrus, wheat and herbs. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a wheaty, citrusy finish. Summery beer.

Schneider Weisse on ilahduttanut meitä jo parilla muullakin Alkon valikoimiin tipahtaneella oluella viime aikoina. TAP2 Mein Kristall kaatuu lasiin vaaleana ja kellertävänä. Sen päälle muodostuu valkoinen vaahto. Tuoksu on yrttinen, hiivainen, banaaninen ja sitruksinen. Maultaan olut on pehmeän humaloitu, hedelmäinen ja yrttinen. Maku on kuitenkin hieman lattea tuoksuun verrattuna. Suutuntumaltaan olut taasen on hieman vetisenpuoleinen, mutta hieman liukas.
Appearance clear and pale. Taste sweet and very lightly bitter. Palate of banana and other fruits; very light. Soft carbon.
A very clean beer, it is light, but refreshing, and as it warms it gets a lot better.
Bottle. Clear golden with big foamy white head. Flavour is malt, wheat, little clove, dry, little banana, little bitter with a watery palate.
Bottle. Golden with a medium head. Aroma is a lighter version of hefe, candy and fruit. Light and refreshing candy flavour with a slight metallic hint to the finish
Bottle, TAP 2. I never understood Kristall - why remove all the best parts from a wheat beer? That said, this is a decent enough example of the style, but Ill take a Hefeweizen any day.

Bottle at Wachi. Fruity aroma, quite lager-like. Clean, fruity flavor with light banana and clove flavors. Clean and light, relatively tasty and nice-drinking but nothing at all like their hefeweizen. This is a style I cant understand.

Tap at their Munich beerhall. Huge white head; clear light gold body with lots of rising carbonation.  Banana and citrus are there in the aroma, but slightly muted.  Taste is a bit of a let down, and for some reason I get loads of bubblegum and sweetness on this.  Begs the question of what filter a hefe...eh
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is heavy banana and yeasty. Flavor is medium sweet and slightly acidic. Very good Kristallweizen. 260211
This is a good Kristal and not a bad beer overall. I think as far as Kristals go one of my top picks.

Bottle in a bar in Berlin - 17/12/10. Im not the biggest Kristallweizen fan but thought I would give this a shot and was pleasantly surprised. Had a grapefruit nose and then tasted quite strongly of banana with some spice as well.

50cl bottle from the Doemens stash. Clear bright gold color with a big white head. Very clovey aroma with some vanilla and banana taking up the rear. Quite dry and attenuated with a good amount of clove and lighter fruitiness. Dry mouthfeel with high carbonation. A very dry and spritzy take on the German wheat beer.
Pour at Warners at the Bay Beer Festival 2010. Quite nice for a wheat beer. Full of citrus and spice in both the aroma and taste. Wouldnt really get it again, but nice for what it is.
Bottle. Mild banana aroma - taste follows suit. A nice, easy-to-drink beer.
Pours a light yellow straw color with a fluffy white head. Smell of some banana but seems to be a bit on the sweet side. Taste was the same. Not a huge fan of this style of beer.
Bottle. Pale straw color with a medium white head. Decent malty flavour, but not especially good. a decent balance of wheat and fruit flavors.

This really smells wonderful, bananas and cloves in a great balance. Very clear, looks just like the pils I alos ordered. Flavor is on the light side but a bit more than the liecht and better for it. Pretty good stuff.

Bottle. Pours a pale straw yellow color, just like a pale lager, with a frothy off white head. Aroma is of slight banana, spice like clove and pepper and some breadyness and wheat along with some doughy yeast. Body is quite light and with a slightly dry mouthfeel. Overall an ok Kristallweizen, but i prefer Hefes.

500 ML bottle in Germany. A nice clear pour and fine lacing of the head with its golden clear color. Aroma is strong banana pudding. Taste is creamy and very smooth for a Kristall. Palate is also very pleasant for a Kristall. One of the top Kristalls in my book.

Bottle.  Sweet banana, bubblegum, clove and wheat malt aroma - nice.  Clear golden yellow color with giant white fluffy head. and mild effervescence.  Slightly sweet banana/orange, clove, and wheat malt flavor.  Medium body.  Nice summer beer.
Beautiful to look at.  Bananas and cloves and all the uusal wheat beer signs.  Very good.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is clear golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, wheat malt and hops.

Lightly hazy.  Light straw colour.  Thick head.  The aroma has banana but mixed with mango.  Full body.  Light banana.  Some wheaty character, leading to a doughy finish.  I suppose it is good for style, for what its worth.

Bottle @ Brauhaus, Phnom Penh. Clear gold color. Aroma is sour, yeasty. They put lemon in the glass without asking which makes the aroma quite nice compared to the way it smells in the bottle alone--less sour. The acidity from that smooths out the sticky yeast in the flavor and palate too.

Bottle. Clear golden body with a large, fluffy white head that lasts for ages. Aroma is fairly grainy with notes of citrus, yeast, banana, spice and with a hint of funkiness. Flavour is similar and slightly tangy with citrus, wheat and banana standing out. Smooth mouthfeel with a hint of bitterness and a long dry finish. Maybe not up to the standard of the original Schneider Weisse, but still very drinkable and, for a kristall, quite flavoursome.
tasted alongside schofferhofer kristall. This was the pick of the two. Much creamier and rounded. Nice citrusy, banana, yeasty aroma. Nice complex body with very high carbonation.
Bottle at NB-ølsymposium. Clear yellow - white head. Sulfor, yeasty, wlderflowers, wheaty, banana, orange, honey, white bread, medium carbonation.

Bottle 50cl.Clear light to medium yellow color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate yeasty, fruity, bananan, light rubber. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20091015]

500ml bottle. Plae straw colour with a rocky head of pufy white foam. Well carbonated with a very sweet aroma of banana lollies. Light in the mouth with a good body and well balanced flavour with some sweetness coming through.

Bottle, bought @ Ambrosetti, Berlin.
Pours clear, pale golden with a magnificent, creamy, white head. Great duration. A few bubbles lazily creep towards the firm head. Aroma is quite bready, some slight banana and a metallic edge. Highish carbonation, fine, rather creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is fine, sweet, bready, light banana and some green apples. Fair hoppy bitterness in the end. Still, a kristall is a bit sex-less.

(Bottle on 2009-02-09) Golden and clear. Medium sized quite quickly disappearing white head. Banana and fruitiness in aroma. Medium bodied palate with quite a lot of carbonation. Banana, bitterness, fruitiness and hint of white bread in taste. Bitter and fruity aftertaste.

...bottle.  Poured a clear yellow with a fluffy white head that was lasting with lacing.  On the nose was clove notes, wheat, yeast, and fruits.  Flavors were slightly spicy, malty, wheaty and yeasty.  Smooth carbonation, crips flavor.  Very refreshing, with a light flavorful creamy finish.  I think this is the best kristall I have had so far.
Shared this with oldrtybastrd.  This pours a watery golden color with a small white head that has very little lacing.  This is pils like but with more flavor but still watery.

Shared w/ SkyCop32.  Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt.  Pours a nice golden yellow.  Aromas of of citrus, fruit,  and a little yeasty.  Flavor is crips, almost pilsner like.  A little hops at the end.
on tap @ Schneider Weiss Brauhaus in Munich. Very pale yellow color. Light aromas of clove, banana & wheat. Light mouthfeel. Hefe qualites in very light body

Draught at Schneider Weisses Brauhaus, Munich.
Very pale yellow coloured, small white head that went away slowly, pleasant wheaty yeasty nose. No carbonation at all, just few bubbles. Fruity, light yeasty and mild spicy taste with notes of apricot in rather sweet finish.
Pours gold with a generouw white head.  Smells of wheat, straw, perfume.  Tastes of citrus, lightly tarte, some hints of hefeweizen.  Crisp dry clean finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear yellow and holds a huge white head. Medium dry banana estery aroma. Medoum sweet fruity flavour. Light banana and mild orange fruity. Goes into a classic estery flavour - towards dry wheaty into the finish.
Clear golden with huge white head. Sweet fruity aroma with notes of wheat,yeast and banana. Sweet flavor with hints of wheat,yeast and loads of banana. Ends sweet.
Clear golden short lasting head. Weak notes of yeast, banana and citrus. Flavour is sweet with short sweet finish.
a nice refreshing drop,  fruityish, but has a bit of a weird aftertaste. Gets  nicer as u go along. Hard to get here in OZ.

Good frothy head,rapid now easing carbonation,on a straw coloured beer,with a good look.Aroma wheat,malt good hop notes,brown sugar notes.Flavour,wheat is beautiful,malt,can taste brown sugar,even a liccorice flavour.Finish sweet and mellow,bloody lovely Herr schneider old son.

Bottled at Oliver Twist, Stockholm.  Clear pale golden, rich fluffy hwad. Biscuity banana aroma. Sweet and fruity, medium bodied. Lots of banana esters, some raspberry, caramel  and butter. Quite refreshing, though a bit sweet. Lots of flavour has survived the filtering.

Garrafa, 500 ml, em fevereiro de 2008. Coloração dourada translúcida, com creme branco não consistente, nem persistente. Notas de cravo, tanto no aroma quanto no sabor. Carbonatação média/alta. Levemente adocicada.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Very much foam. Tastes not really like a hefeweizen, finish too dry. Not a good beer.

essa é uma feliz junção de maltes de cevada e trigo.
O resultado é refrescante, perfeito para um domingo de 37ºC de verão.
Com alta carbonatação, pode acompanhar pratos apimentados, como comida mexicana, sem ser afetada pelo sabor da comida e limpando o paladar automaticamente. Ideal para qualquer horário, desde que esteja bem gelada

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2008 Muito agradável. Cerveja frutada, bananas, levemente adocicada. Espuma branca e densa, ótima formação. Coloração amarelo ouro, parecida com uma pilsen, cheiro maltado, suavemente frutado. Sabor denso, maltado. Refrescante, como todas as boas Weiss.

Bottle. The beer is Golden color with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of Banana and citrus. Flavor is refreshing with a sweet touch and notes of Banana. Mouthfeel is sweet and refreshing. Good one!Português: Cerveja dourada com uma boa espuma. Aroma doce e frutado com notas de banana e cítrico. Sabor refrescante e com um toque adocicado e notas de banana. Sensação na boca é doce e refrescante. Muito boa!
Orange hazy beer with a cremy fine laced white head. Oranges are dominantly present in the aroma. Flavor is a balance between fruitiness (oranges), malts and yeast. Not lasting. Empty finish

Golden and shine color. Good head.
Aroma: Banana, citrus, sweet.
Palate: Banana, malt, citrus, a litlle bitter.
Refreshing beer.

Golden colored, lively carbonation. Huge white head. Sweet banana in fruity aroma, rather rich one even when having this as ice cold. Medium bodied. Flavor starts with watery palate, but ending turns to nicely fruity with banana and high carbonation. Some dryness from hops also in aftertaste. Crispy, basic kristall.
Very light and clear with a large head. Mild wheat, some banana... but not enough. I like the big clove flavour in the Schneider Weisse Original but this is sadly absent here. Rather dull overall.

Bottled. Golden coloured. Quite clear. Dense white head. Light yeast, light spice and very light banana in the aroma. Flavour is a bit more characterful. Yeast, fruits, cloves and cookies. Is medium bodied. Sweetish and light spiced end.

Had this at the Schneider Haus in Munich as well as a great German meal. A little lemony and I like the regular non filtered hefe more. Page 418 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide and only 255 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.
Clear yellow with really nice white head. Lemon, grass, banana and citrusy. Nicely balanced and with nice bitterness and freshness. Desent...

Havent had much kristalls and Im not too much of a weize fan either. This one looks like a lager/pils, but packs quite a bit of wheatbeer taste. Not too yeasty nor bananalike, yet they both definately are there.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with a huge mostly lasting white head. The germans really know how to make presentable beer. The Aroma was nice of wheat and yeast, but the flavour was a bit weak compared to eg. weihenstephaner kristall. Below Schneider standard.

500ml bottle serving it chilled in weizen glass. Faint grassiness on the nose, bit of banana bread-like yeast and a metallic note. Looks a treat with a sparkling golden body and big pillowy white head and lace. Filling in the mouth. Light fruit flavours on the palate, some citrus, banana, candyish notes; also a bit of bread and spice. Dry sort of finish, a tiny bit abrupt. Quite enjoyable regardless.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a big white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast and fruit.

Not the best of Kristalls, not denying it filled a spot in between here and the next beer. Im starting to wonder about the beers of this Brauerei, not really living up to the earnt hype of years before, has brewing changed recently!?!
Poured into its own tall weiss glass. Bright, dull, pale gold with a huge flurry of carbonation releasing out to an immense, rocky white crown (grew an inch out the glass) that held in place needing a good chomp to bite it off. Lace work was meticulous as it ebbed down the glass. Aroma was almost distant with faint bubblegum and summer grains being the only things I could detect. Nothing else. Zingy lemons in the mouth as it whips furiously across the palate. There is a nice touch of summer grains here, wheaty but subtle. Very light bodied, like mineral water, and a little too fizzy even of style. Touch of white bread mid-palate, light sour malt shows late before a clean, crisp finish with just a little wheat malt lingering briefly. This didnt offer much, weissbier relies on a balance of spicy phenolics and sweet/sour fruit esters. Where were they..., on a break, maybe a holiday!?!. This was wonderfully refreshing (like spritzig wasser), subtle, in fact almost lifeless, but easy to drink none-the-less. But it just wasnt a Weizenbier. (50cL, 09/04/06, The Beer Store Morley, tasted in March this year)

50 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Golden clear colour with a huge white head. Light aroma of yeast an bread. Refreshing flavour of wheat combined with fruitness and yeast. Very light and easy to drink.

Pours clear with a white head and excelent lacing. Aroma showed some slight banana, a little stale.  The body seems to be much the same, similar to an unfilterd wheatbeer but less, and a little sour and grainy. So much character has been taken out that it heads in the direction of pale lagers. The finish is bland, like the aroma,  body, and for that matter.. style.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2007 Poured clear (of course) golden orange, with a pillowy white head that tend to last. Slightly metallic aroma of creamy banana and some light cloves notes. There was also a little bit of alcohol and weak bugglegum. The flavour was a bit bland, with some shallow bitterness, but enough to have you searching for the next gulp. The palate was indeed metallic, and a little too thin, although the carbonation was at a pleasant level. This beer starts off well, by looking and smelling great, but fell away a bit when it hit the mouth. Anyway, its not too shabby.

Bottle: Very pale golden; huge off-white fluffy head, rather quickly diminishing; fruity, citrusy and grainy nose, traces of cloves and bavarian bananas; very light sweetish flavour, creamy mouthfeel; very light bodied, but not watery; faint fruity (citrus, bananas again) finish. Not bad, not really necessary.....................

Poured a clear yellow/brown with a medium white head.  The aroma, appearance and taste reminded me quite a bit of american pale lagers that I despise.  I am typically a dark beer man, so that may influence me.  I simply didnt care for this beer, but my friend absoutley loved his.
Bottle. Creamy excellent white mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Nice malty aroma. OK flavour and palate.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pale golden with a decent head. Rather light-bodied with some faint notes of wheat, but naturally not much fruitiness (thats left back in the filter right now). Dry and slightly sulphurous. Ill never be a huge fan of Kristalls. 210500

For a kristal, this brew is quite good. Crisp and light on the tongue, bracing yet never intrusive. The fruit and cloves rescue it from being boring, while not demanding too much from the drinker. A good pub brew.
Pale yellow body with a solid white head. Wheaty, light spicy aroma with a fruity sweetness. Wheaty flavor with a citric note and some banana sweetness.

Clear golden colour. Medium, very frothy and dense head. Aroma is slightly yeasty and citric. Banana flavour is quite strong for a kristallweizen. Otherwise it´s citric with notes of cloves and hints of yeast. Medium body combined with a good mouthfeel. I really dig this one. Quite nice.

(bottle) Clear golden body with a thick foamy white head. Slight banana and citrus notes in the aroma with a hint of clove. Rather bland taste, thin but crispy, but everything missing I´m expecting for a mouthful of Weizen. Ok, I´m not so in Kristallweizen, but this one is quite disappointing, at least compared to its bigger brothers/sisters from Schneider.

Bottle. This one surprised me. I was expecting it to be inferior in all ways to the hefe version. Significantly lighter than the hefe version, crystal clear light gold with plenty of efferescence as expected, and a big white head that I had trouble controlling on the pour. Aroma was true to style, very much like its hefe brother. I was expecting a somewhat muted taste, but was very surprised as it was full of flavour, cleaner but less complex than the "mit hefe". Felt a bit lighter in the mouth, but I guess that is to be expected. Very nice Krystal! Would be a good way to introduce the style to those unable to cope with cloudiness. I really need to try this one again alongside its hefe brother.

Light, spritzy kristalweizen. Fair summer drinking but a long way from the brewers best work. Poured a pale gold colour with a lasting head. The aroma has honey and wheat notes, plus a dash of spice. Very light on its toes and clean-tasting. Not enough body for my taste but its in style. Highly carbonated - quite champagne-like. (Bottle)

Bottle (dated 11/09/04 - I suspect this is the bottling date): This was a good looking beer from the start. Clear gold with a fine bead and a big white head that formed a peak above the rim of the glass. A sweet, spicey aroma lifted from the glass immediately. Upon closer inspection some malty vanilla and lemony notes came to attention. The flavour was more restrained but perhaps a little more complex - fruity (sweet lemon) with a slight initial hop flavour that grew to a mellow garnish on a very simple but satisfying wheaty malt base. Silky in the mouth with a very fine level of carbonation and refreshing yet low bitterness. I really liked this.

Pours a big fizzy head, looks almost icy.  Varietal nose with touches of larger traits but a bit subdued.

Fairly non-descript palate, seems a bit flat in the flavour department, giving nothing away.  Faint orange peel notes at best.  Disappointing.

(Note: drank a week after use by date...perhaps explains the poor showing?)

Bottled at Bermuda Brau, Wien. Golden hazed beer with lasting white head. Highly carbonated with a spicy sharp clear wheat note. Restrained flavours through the beer but a clear orange note on the finish.

Good size white head on top of a clear light golden body. Aroma was faint with some vanilla and banana. Taste wasnt full or anything but it went down easily, some citrus coming through along with the banana and a touch of spice.

interlaken, switzerland draft:  tried this one side by side with their hefe. this isnt nearly as good.  clear istead of hazy. head is snow white fluff.   that pops away when you stick your finger in it. less notes of fruit and spice but still their with some banana clove. slighty more dry and refreshing. go  for the hefe it you have the choice.

hay, biscuity malt, bubblegum, hint of menthol and citrus aromas.
clear golden, small head, medium carbonation.
bubblegum, spicy, floral hops, biscuity and citrus.
dry carbonated bitterness that fades quickly to a refreshing clean palate.
nice kristal, refreshing, I prefer hefes though ;)
Nice golden with a big head and strong carbonation and very slight haze. Bubblegum and clove aroma, with some citrusy notes. flavour is banana and spice, nothing great, but not bad either.
Light clear blond color. Lightly spicy and banana aroma. Sooooo simple taste, watery, a bit sweet.
Yellow coloured. Some banana in the aroma. Very thin and rather sour flavour. A lousy brew.
Piss yellow beer with a foamy white head. Wheat, banana and hay aroma. Flavor of banana, wheat and yeast. Very weak and boring for a Weissbier!
A clear orange beer with a diappearing white head. The aroma is of sour wheat. The flavor of banana and wheat. Boring kristalweizen.

Strong Vanilla scent.

Big head which hangs around for ever. Very clear and pale. No cloudiness at all.

Light carbonation on the tongue. Slight bitterness. I am wondering what chucking a bit of lemon into this would do? Maybe I try that next time when I have some lemon lying around.

Nice enough, but nothing memorable. I keep thinking that a kristall ought to be a brilliant summer afternoon beer but they never seem to deliver. Maybe I have it all wrong.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2006 Looks great in the glass, head retention is good. Lacking some of the aromas I really like (sweet wheat malt, peachy fruitiness) whilst a bit strong on the vanilla and clove. Bubble gum and banana also present at low levels. 
Has a nice sweet maltiness but not the juicy maltiness that makes some other Weizens so good. Very slight bitterness which I could have done without.

A poor brother to the Edel Weisse. It pours almost clean(not cloudy) and keeps a dandy head to the end.  Flavours are a tad subtle with a lemon flavour leading the pack, although they don't linger as much as they should.
Not as complex as the Edel Weisse.  Yeasty fruitiness is subdued due to filtering.  I think this may be the best of summer quenchers, though.  It's my fishing beer.

A bit like the filtered version of the real thing. Clean is the word that springs to mind, but like most cleanliness this is not neccessarily close to Godliness. There is the anticipated wheat notes of clove and citrus and good mouthfeel. A well crafted beer that presents well.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: not exciting but a cut above most kristalls. crisp, some lemonade flavour, clear, golden, predictable

judging from this page it seems they make this for special export to australia. send the 12% eisbocks to america, send the filtered bland stuff to the australians. wheaty, tangy, and clean, with a nice perfume. missing the creaminess and palate complexity of the hefe but you knew that already. still good beer.
Pours with a huge head. Aroma and flavour are slightly sweet and very spicy, cloves? Has low bitterness. Wow this is a great brewery!

Slight grain nose plus some yeast.
Golden color like a pilsner, but big white frothy head.
A bit lemon in the taste.
The Kristall is not quite the usual meal and the finish is rather bland.

Rerate (a few days later): I think this was a much better bottle. Seemed less harch on the palate and a nicer overall flavour. Had a fluffier head too (*almost* like the picture...)

Original rating (3): Banana and cloves... really a typical german wheat. Its nice, but Im kind of jaded of weizens lately. Its not outstanding enough to shake me out of it.
first beer of the morning while having a early lunch of wurst and pretzels at the brewery refreshing and like a pils in some respects

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2003 I"ve had this on three or four occasions, and alwasys like it. Clovey, wheaty, soft yeastiness ,i.e, typical german kristall wheat, smooth. Some tart lemony characters, nice and fresh, i don"t know whether its the hot weather, but i"m really enjoying this.
A good kristall, good aroma, an easy drinker. Not bad at all, roll on summer.
A great kristall style of wheat beer. Lovely fruity flavours and a spritzig palate. This demonstrates the classic taste of German kristall wheat beer.
Keep a medium pace to avoid bloating. Easy drinker. Dump some of the fizz...
